    • Constructor Detail

      • Card

        public Card(int s,
            int r)
        Constructor for Card object
        Parameters:
        s - describes the suit of the Card object. 1 represents hearts, 2 represents diamonds, 3 represents clubs, 4 represents spades
        r - describes the rank of the Card object. 2 through 10 represent their respective value, 11 is jack, 12 is queen, 13 is king, 14 is ace.

    • Method Detail

      • getSuit

        public int getSuit()
        Gets the suit of the Card object.
        Returns:
        returns the suit of the Card object

      • setSuit

        public void setSuit(int s)
        Sets suit the suit of the Card object
        Parameters:
        s - is an integer passed describing the suit of the Card object. If the value is 1, the suit is hearts. If the value is 2, the suit is diamonds. If the value is 3, the suit is clubs. If the value is 4 the suit is spades.

      • getRank

        public int getRank()
        Gets the rank of the Card object.
        Returns:
        returns the rank of the Card object

      • setRank

        public void setRank(int r)
        Sets the rank of the Card object
        Parameters:
        r - is an integer passed describing the rank of the Card object. standard numerical cards, 2 through 10, are kept as the same. If the card is a jack, its rank is 11. If the card is a queen, its rank is 12. If the card is a king, its rank is 13. If the card is an ace, its rank is 14.

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo(Card c)
        compareTo method compares the rank of the calling Card object to the rank of the passed Card object
        Parameters:
        c - is the Card object passed for comparison to the calling object
        Returns:
        check is the integer returned to describe the comparison. If the rank of the cards are equal, a 0 is returned. If the rank of the calling object is greater than the arguement, a 1 is returned. If the rank of the calling object is less than the arguement, a -1 is returned.

      • toString

        public String toString()
        toString method combines the suit and rank of the Card object for concatenation with ".jpg" so images can be retrieved. The concatenation of the rank and suit is as follows: str = strRank + strSuit;
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object
        Returns:
        is equal to the concatenation of the rank and suit of the card. The method toString converts the suit and rank to a individual strings, concatenates them, and then returns the value
